tweets: i just muted 500ppl, cleansed following, purged interests in settings, added a bunch of block words, searched for things i find interesting and liked all of it, and my feed went from 97% politics and shit posts back to old x in an hour
Survival mode is not just feeling stressedâ€”it's your body operating on autopilot to protect you.

It's more important to develop a values system that is broadly applicable than worrying about the specific application. i would be scared to ever figure my life out too much, all the cool stuff has happened in the liminal spaces.

The Jhanas are real. This is a crazy fact. All the things they say about bliss on demand, infinite blah blah, they're real. Hard to put to words obviously, but the closest phrase I have to convey the feeling is "infinite happiness" (on J3).
The more you ignore your needs, the more they control you.

Not a lot of people understand this... but you actually don't have to have an opinion about everything. You don't have to decide if something is good or bad. Marcus Aurelius says limiting the amount of opinions we have is one of the most powerful things we can do in life.

Healing is not meant to leave us in a spot where the only skill in our arsenal is unpacking & analyzing our emotions. The idea is to develop that skill *in service of* becoming more flexible, courageous and capable of adapting to the lives we actually want.

I tentatively believe that people who want to "get into meditation" are probably better suited cleaning up diet and lifestyle first however they can, and also doing a ton of forgiveness meditation before worrying about anything like shamatha or vipassana. clearing out the system
Life is going so fast because you're not injecting enough silence into your days. Spend an hour reading or writing or walking in silence and watch how your day seems to double in duration

last night i dreamt i was healing men and helping even the toughest ones with the hardest exteriors relax into their softness and remember their deep, embodied, present, alive nature within , showing them they don't need to always Prove or Fight . that sometimes they can Just Be.
mental tension, a subtle form of internal violence faster than thought, is at the root of all your problems
i'm not sure why people are so afraid to be seen when all the best things in life happen when you expose yourself more courageously to the world
it is essential to see your intuition as your anchor instead of other people's opinions of you as your anchor
reminder: you definitely don't need any expensive biotech to stimulate your vagus nerve and self-regulate. Low-pitch humming works absurdly well.

attributes.name: practicality
attributes.prompt: how much more practical/advice-giving is tweet A than tweet B?

attributes.name: wisdom
attributes.prompt: how much more wisdom-based or philosophical is tweet A than tweet B?

attributes.name: meditativeness
attributes.prompt: how much more about self-regulation, presence, or awareness is tweet A than tweet B?

attributes.name: perspective_shift
attributes.prompt: how much more cognitively liberating or perspective-shifting is tweet A than tweet B?

attributes.name: memorability
attributes.prompt: how much more likely is tweet A to be remembered after 24 hours than tweet B?

attributes.name: stickiness
attributes.prompt: how much more likely is tweet A to change someone's behavior long-term than tweet B?

attributes.name: emotion_intensity
attributes.prompt: how much more emotionally powerful is tweet A than tweet B?

attributes.name: actionability
attributes.prompt: how much more immediately actionable is tweet A than tweet B?

attributes.name: spirituality
attributes.prompt: how much more does tweet A touch on deep spiritual or existential themes than tweet B?

attributes.name: groundedness
attributes.prompt: how much more grounded and down-to-earth is tweet A than tweet B?

attributes.name: control_vs_surrender
attributes.prompt: how much more does tweet A emphasize control over one's life rather than surrendering to its flow?

attributes.name: mystical_energy
attributes.prompt: how much more mysterious, surreal, or dreamlike is tweet A than tweet B?

attributes.name: calming_effect
attributes.prompt: how much more likely is tweet A to make someone feel calm and reassured than tweet B?

attributes.name: self_inquiry
attributes.prompt: how much more does tweet A encourage deep personal reflection than tweet B?

attributes.name: truth_bomb
attributes.prompt: how much more does tweet A feel like a direct, undeniable truth bomb than tweet B?
